subject: Re: Nuplas Server

Let's catch up tomorrow and we can run through it together. Let me know when suits.


Kind regards,

Hi Jamie, 

We have crossed checked the styling elements they are now updated to match the original design. 

Regarding the WooCommerce updaters, we ran the 'data update' one. The setup Wizard needs to be reviewed with you as there is some specific information required. If you like, you can login and run it, or we can have a call and do together tomorrow. Let me know your preference?

Hi Heath,

I'm also noticing some subtle differences and config and typography - see attached.

The staging is correct however production is slightly off.






Kind regards,

Jamie Shek

I'm just adding some new products and noticed that the woo commence database update script was not run after the plugin update.

Can you have a look at this please? In the future this will need to happen along with any WooCommerce plugin updates.




Kind regards,

Hi Heath,

Everything on the site is looking good. One thing - in an attempt to save time I added some custom styles into the theme customizer settings. Can you please remove this and build it into the theme stylesheet?

I'm happy for you and your team to push the updates to the production site. As mentioned, lets put the site in maintenance mode.


#coupon_code::placeholder {
color: #6b7069;
font-weight: 600;
}

.shopkeeper-mini-cart .widget.woocommerce.widget_shopping_cart .widget_shopping_cart_content .cart_list.product_list_widget li.mini_cart_item .quantity,
.shopkeeper-mini-cart .widget.woocommerce.widget_shopping_cart .widget_shopping_cart_content p.total {
color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 1);
font-size: 16px;
font-weight: 600;
}

#zip-tagline{
display: inline-block !important;
margin-bottom: 10px;
}

.site-top-message:before {
content: '';
display: inline-block;
width: 30px;
height: 15px;
background: url(/wp-content/uploads/sites/5/2018/08/australia-flag-xs.png);
background-size: cover;
margin-right: 7px;
position: relative;
top: 3px;
}



Kind regards,

Jamie Shek
Director, Maker's Mark Creative

Hi Jamie, 

Hope you are well. We have now updated the theme and plugins on the staging server, ready for your review: https://staging.nuplasapiaristsupplies.com.au/

The database transfer is still giving us grief with the export and importing (even with PHPMyAdmin). This shouldn't affect the site though. We are however updating the database manually for this first update process, but moving forward, it is not a feasible solution. 

If you can please have a look over the staging site, it would be appreciated and then once you are happy for us to apply the changes on the live site, we will do so.

Hi Heath,

You can download the them file here - https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1-4lDaai_gm1XdrM2iyLhchVwagWewHCE?usp=sharing

Kind regards,



Jamie Shek

Probably the best way will be to send us fresh download of the them files.

We not seeing the same 'update available' screen that you are for some reason? See attached screen shot. 

Are you able to send us your Envato logins, or to download the latest version for us and send it over so that we can manually update the site?

Great, thanks Jamie. 

We will update on Staging and let you know when Staging is ready to review. Once we have your go-ahead we will the schedule the updates on the live site to happen out of hours.

action.text: Heath Maguire assigned to Joel Maligalig

full_threads.body:
Hi Heath,

We have installed phpMyAdmin under each domain.

First one can be found here:
http://nuplasgroup.com.au/phpmyadmin/ <http://nuplasgroup.com.au/phpmyadmin/>

The initial administration login is nuplasprod with the password Mmng33AtIy7UT7V

Second one here:
http://staging.nuplasgroup.com.au/phpmyadmin/

The initial administration login is staging.nuplasgroup with the password Mmng33AtIy7UT7V

Let me know if there’s a problem.

Kind regards,

Jamie Shek
Director, Maker’s Mark Creative

// M 0423 592 912
// E jamie@makersmarkcreative.com.au <mailto:jamie@makersmarkcreative.com.au>
// A Level 1, 616 Balcombe Road, Black Rock, 3193 VIC

The material contained in this email may be confidential, and may also be the subject of copyright and/or privileged information. If you are not the intended recipient, please delete it. Internet communications are not secure and accordingly Maker’s Mark Creative does not accept any legal liability for the contents or damage caused by this message.

> On 10 Oct 2018, at 17:30, Heath Maguire <heath@wpperk.com> wrote:
>
> Hi Jamie,
>
> Thanks for the below, I have commented there it keep it all lined up.
>
> I suggest we move forward and see if we can work in the environment once phpmyadmin is added. I’m willing to spend up to another 4 hours to investigate and get it working for us.
>
> Obviously this would be done on the staging server to avoid any complications.
>
> Does that suit you?
>
> Thanks and speak soon,
>
> Heath Maguire
> Director
>
> E. heath@wpperk.com <mailto:heath@wpperk.com> | P. 1300 072 134 | M. 0415 162 271
>
>
> <https://wpperk.com/>
>
>> On 10 Oct 2018, at 11:43 am, Jamie Shek <jamie@makersmarkcreative.com.au <mailto:jamie@makersmarkcreative.com.au>> wrote:
>>
>> Hi Heath,
>>
>> I’ve got a response back from Roger. Does any of this make things easier for you?
>>
>>
>> What is the best way to export and import the databases? Is there a phpMyAdmin interface?
>> phpMyAdmin needs to be installed. I can do that if you like or you can (it’s in install scripts). Importing a database is simple, go to edit database, then import. I use sql files to do this which phpMyAdmin creates when exporting.
>
> *This would certainly help and yes, if Robert can install it, that would be great.
>
>> What is the best way to overwrite the staging (directory and/or databases) with the live versions?
>> Not too sure with this one. Originally it was setup by Tim, maybe ask him the process he used (although I know that there was an issue when he renamed the staging to live – caused a certificate loop). How I would do this though after thinking about it is I would make sure in the staging server that everything is deleted. Drop the database tables too. After importing the live database into the staging server you will need to edit the database table that contains the URL to the live site (wo-options). After this you should be able to login.
>
> *Yes, this is the approach we would take too.
>> Can you fill me in on why there is a virtual server for each domain name, when technically they are all part of the same WordPress install… is this to do with the domain name mapping?
>> I believe it is to do with the multi-site installation. They are only aliases and not actual domains. There are only the two actuals, the live and the staging servers. RDS8.com.au <http://rds8.com.au/> is the server hostname.
>
> *Ok, I guess this is one of those ‘if it ain’t broken…’ scenarios.
>> Are there any server level search and replace tools (this will be required when copying for live to staging).
>> Being a Linux box there are search and replace tools common to those servers. However Vitrualmin has a neat file manager that allows this I believe. Otherwise just use sftp. Filezilla works well. Connect, download (good to have copy remotely too) then upload to the staging server.
>> Hope this answers your questions.
>
> *If we have php my admin we can do it through there
>
>>
>> Kind regards,
>>
>> Jamie Shek
>> Director, Maker’s Mark Creative
>>
>> // M 0423 592 912
>> // E jamie@makersmarkcreative.com.au <mailto:jamie@makersmarkcreative.com.au>
>> // A Level 1, 616 Balcombe Road, Black Rock, 3193 VIC
>>
>> The material contained in this email may be confidential, and may also be the subject of copyright and/or privileged information. If you are not the intended recipient, please delete it. Internet communications are not secure and accordingly Maker’s Mark Creative does not accept any legal liability for the contents or damage caused by this message.

>>> What is the best way to overwrite the staging (directory and/or databases) with the live versions?
>>> Can you fill us in on why there is a virtual server for each domain name, when technically they are all part of the same WordPress install… is this to do with the domain name mapping perhaps?
>>> Do you have any server level search and replace tools (this will be required when copying for live to staging).
>>> Are there any other unique elements we should be aware of?
>>>
>>> Thanks and speak soon,
